text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Copper colour, small brown head. Aroma is floral, mild tart wood, some slight berries and a bit dry sappy notes. Flavour is raspberries, some sour and tart wooden notes with mild berries as well as quite high acidicness.
Bottle. Pours a clear dark red with a thin beige head. Aroma of malt, raspberry jam and sourness. Malt and raspberry flavor with a tart fruit finish.

Murky brown on the pour, looks like a headless Porter in the glass. Great balanced slightly acidic leaning aroma and flavor of Brett and bugs and raspberries and oak. Quite sour stopping short of being agressive. Just what Id hoped for from the description.
Bardzo agresywne, intensywne. Wysoka, wyraźnie octowa kwasowość, delikatnie paląca w przełyk i ściągająca usto. Mimo wszystko bardzo smaczne

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. This is a deep dark bronze looking one, on the top theres a nice medium sized quite sidesticking beige top. On the nose I get sour prunes and plums. Apricot also I think. Some raspberries for sure also and its dark sugary yet really sour. Lovely aroma. It has a mid oily texture in the mouth and its just above average on the carbonation. Sharp and lemonic in the taste. Lots of sour dark ripe raspberries. It has a near syrup concentration also. Woody and mouthdrying in the aftertaste. Again, really nice one from this fantastic brewer. 14.05.2016

(On tap @ CBC 2016 Red Session, Copenhagen) Pours deep brown, reddish highlights, tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, jammy raspberry, light sour cherry, quite oaky, balsamic notes, yeasty funk, pretty tart but with a sweet core as well. Flavour is quite sour despite some solid sweet malt as a backbone, notes of raspberry, tart red berries, oaky wood, lightly vinous, yeast, moderate funk, balsamic, hints of toast. Finish is a mix of persistent sour and dry woody, yeasty character. Medium body, a bit oily, soft carbonation. High sourness level as typical for Rare Barrel, but it works well with this style.
At Max Place, pours brown with a beige head, aroma of brett, cherries, berries, wood, flavor of berries, sourish, brett, medium bodied, great

Draft @ CBC 2016. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sour tart woody raspberry aroma. Fruity sour tart woody raspberry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody raspberry finish.

Wow, cant believe I hadnt rated this. Had it many times, during the dark ages where many ticks were tragically lost to the ravages of history. Bottle pours dark reddish brown with a lasting light khaki head. Aroma is sharp raspberry, lactic, oak, cherry. Flavor is sharply tart, lots of fruit, raspberry, cherry, even a tiny hint of dark malty sweetness. Medium body, sharp, higher carbonation. Really solid.

Sample at Hoof Hearted during the "Zipper Ripper vs Everybody Wants Some Mosaic - Ticketed Event" on 02/04/2017. Murky dark reddish-brown color with a medium thin off-white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Strings of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of tart berries, oak, yeast and malt. Light to medium body with a tart cherry and berry character and notes of yeast and doughy malt. The finish is moderately sour with a raspberry and cherry aftertaste. Very good beer all around.
Poured a ruby red color with a pinkish head. Aroma was of lots of raspberries, light grainy and acidic. Flavor similar. Not very wild but ok.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Pours a hazy copper brown from the bottle with bubbly off-white head that dissipates quickly to leave little to no lace. Aroma of nice raspberry, oak, and lactic acidity. Taste follows, heavy on the acidity, to the point of burning on the way down. Could be less assertive, but nice stuff.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Bottle thanks to Mike pours. Dale brown with no head. Dates, raspberry. Very sharp sourness. Light mouthfe. Strong carbonation.
Bottle. Nose is lightly tart, oaky with some light fruitiness. Dark brown pour. Taste is moderately sour. Light raspberry flavor. Solid.
From tap at CBC 2016. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of vinegar, oak, berries, fruit, tartness and malt.

courtesy of Arnaud Lambert - cloudy brown beer with a poor head retention; woody aroma with notes of cherries, prunes and mint;fairly sour; full-bodied, dry and with a subtle carbonation; bitter and hugely sour finish of wood, apples and prunes

750ml bottle. Pours out a cola color topped with a tan ring of a head. Nose is nice raspberry sweetness sour tartness barrel presents. Taste is more of the nice raspberry jam notes some light sweetness blends well with the tart.

Thanks to Mike for this awesome brew! Un autre grand coup de coeur pour moi lors de cette belle soirée. Robe dhermine pourpre et soyeuse aux allures de grande noblesse. Mousse généreuse et surprenante en surface. Beaucoup de framboises dans mon verre. Les framboises ont parfaitement fermenté dans ce liquide bien acétique. Une confiture puissante de fruits, des notes lactiques bien présentes sans être non plus démesurées comme elles le sont parfois chez Rare Barrel. Malgré la puissance exercée sur chacun de mes sens, le liquide offre une magnifique complexité. Je sens derrière la framboise une flore bactérienne en folie. Parfaite pour être partagée à trois. À deux ce serait sans doute difficile à boire.

Draught. Dark amber/brown coloured. Dense light beige head. ARoma. Raspberries, light vinegar, sourness, oak. Flavour. Sourness, brett, light ´vinegar, oak, raspberries. Medium to full bodied. Ends sour and full of tart berries. Acidic.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As The Rare Barrel Founders Club #2: Ensorcelled ].Clear dark brown color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, dark malt, roasted, tart raspberry. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart raspberry, dark malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160514]
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Fruity. Aroma of raspberries and lemon with wooden notes. Some brett too. Mainly zesty sour taste. A good one.

750 ml bottle to snifter, shared with the Mrs (2016 vintage; from notes). This batch is 6.2% abv. Looks decent; a murky dark amberish brown with beige head that steadily dissipates into thin lacing. Smells and tastes extremely lactic with lots of raspberry and some oak as well. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied, tart, and mouth-puckeringly acidic. An enamel ripper sipper that I ended up enjoying. One pour is plenty though.
Turbid brown pour. Aromas of raspberry jam and cocoa powder. Taste is quite sour but one of the better dark sours I have had.

bomber shared that poured a dark brown color with slight head. the aroma was amazing. funk, tart, woody, berries, earth, oak. the flavor was all that and more. never quite had a sour like this one. all of those elements came together as one and the raspberries and the oak are marvelous together. excellent job.

CBC 2016 Red session. Black body with a small tanned head. Aroma of funk, wood, berries, malt. Taste of sweet raspberries, dry barnyard, very funky, oak. Smooth and crisp, well balanced mixture of berries and lightly sour elements with a spicy kick. An amazing beer!
Tap @ CBC 16. Pours murky brown with no head. Aroma cherry, sweet flemish notes. balsamic and raspberries. The taste is burning sour with notes of balsamic, raspberries and red currants.
Bottled. Pours deep red. The smell is grape and smells like wine. The palate is sticky and medium bodied. The taste is sour. Has a wooden oak taste with a tart raspberry taste. Great beer.
Tap @ CBC2016. Pours dark brown/red with a small offwhite head. Notes of malt, vinegar, cherries, balsamico, oak, brett.

On tap at the brewery. 
Aroma is fairly raspberry forward with some lighter dark toffee and caramel notes with a hint of chocolate. Light acidity with a hint of citrus and pineapple. Light oak notes. Some cassis and cherry notes as well. 
Pours a murky, muddy dark brown with some red hues and a thick, small, dark tan head that recedes to the edges where it lingers. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor has a moderately strong acidity with a light sweetness. Some caramel and toffee with hints of chocolate. Moderately strong raspberry notes with light citrus and hints of pineapple. Hints of cherry and cassis. Light oak and low bitterness. Some tannins. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice dark sour with good raspberry notes that are balanced with the acidity and malt character. Acidity is well rounded and only a bit sharp.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of sourness, malt, yeast, oak, light vanilla, tart fruit, raspberry. Flavor is heavily sour, malt, yeast, brett, oak, tart fruity, rich raspberry. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, very acidic finish. 140516

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Celebration 2016, Copenhagen - amber red pour with off white head. Medium sour fruity aroma and taste with high raspberry prominence, red berry fruity backing, light wooden notes, lovely.
2016 Bottle (batch 3). Dark red/brown. Lots of jammy raspberry, a touch of oak/wine. Acidic sour (7/10). Really good.

CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, little roasted malts, sour fruit, oak and wood. Flavour is malt, little roasted malt, sour fruit, oak, wood, vinegar, berries, medium dry and medium sweet

Draught @ CBC 2016, Red session, København
Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, raspberry, caramel, tart and funk. Taste is medium sweet and medium sour with a long dry, sour, raspberry, tart and funky finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Keg at cbc16.. Dark brown.. Rich deep Berries.. Dark fruit malts nose.. Dark fruit... Dark Berries.. Rich sour woody fruit...

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Red session. Dark brown color with off white head. Malty an yeasty aroma, tart fruity, berries, caramel, vinous, wood. Sweet and acidic like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
On tap at Beercraft. Pours a dark reddy brown color with a bit of head. Berry aroma. Lots of sour. Good amount of fruit. Sour overpowers a little.
CBC. Hazy brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, raspberries and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 140516
Sample @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Red session. Murky amber pour with a small tan head. Leather, funk ,tart raspberries, some vanilla and light cranberries. Nice!

14-MAY-2016, draft @CBC Red Session with Ulkløbben:-)
Dark, dark amber with a lasting, low, tan head.
Sour fruit, funk, raspberry, Very smooth, fantastic.

[5/14/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Red session. Brown. Huge raspberries aroma with oak, funk, lacto. Sour flavor of juicy raspberries, lacto, vinegar, a bit acidic in the throat. Medium-bodied.

July 28, 2015. Bottle, tasting at jtclockworks, thanks for sharing!
Hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma is tart fruity with raspberries, apple skins, notes of licorice, light roast, light sweet toffee notes. Taste is light sour with some acetic notes, hints of dry tannic oak, light malty and berry sweetness with raspberries and toffee. Light to medium bodied, slightly dry texture, average carbonation. 
Very nice!


 aroma, chocolate, licorice, wild strawberries, tart, floral notes, some grapes. Tart raspberry flavor, raisins, chocolate notes, floral, some wild strawberries. Great one
ansalon	
4
On tap at CBC 2016, day 2. Dark ruby pour with no head. A boatload of fruit sourness, no vinegar whatsoever, a bit of brett dryness and raspberries. Excellent.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, REDblack. Dark sour berries on nose, dark oak, hay old malts. Tart, pretty nkce cherry woody flavour. Super intense, sparkly, long finish. Really nice cherry oak sour.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Almost black with a small head. Tart with berries, funk, some dark malt and dark chocolate. The finish was dry and tart. A nice one.

On tap at CBC 16. Cloudy brown with a ring off white head. Aroma of tart red fruits, berries and light lactic notes. Flavour is light sweet and moderate sour. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Red session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black beer with a nice beige head. Sourish raspberry aroma, chocolate, licorice, wild strawberries, tart, floral notes, some grapes. Tart raspberry flavor, raisins, chocolate notes, floral, some wild strawberries. Great one
CBC2016. Trübes orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach roten Früchten, minimal säuerlich. Geschmack säuerlich, rote Früchte, leicht holzig.
CBC 2016. Pours a very dark brown with a low off white head. Aromas of funk, cherries, red currant, roasted malt, roasted nuts, funk. Taste is very sour and fruity with a very dry and tart mouthfeel.
Tap cbc. Pours cloudy red with a tan head. Aroma of raspberry, funk, huge barn, lactic, fruity. Taste is heavy raspberry, fruity, tart and barn. Very dry and a good complex sour brown. Clean.
Pours deep brown with low tan head. Aroma of raspberries, cherries, light chocolate. Taste is rich tart with sour raspberry finish. Light and smooth body with average carbonation.
From bottle @CBC 2016. Dark brown, thin off white head. Funky, some raspberries, vinegar. Complex, balanced. Ripe fruits, apricots, vinegar touch. Wow.

750ml bottle @CBC 2016. Pours dark brown with a smooth head. Aroma of tart raspberries, vinegary sourness and wood. Taste is aggressively sour, tart and heavy with raspberries and oaky notes. Finish is sourish, tart and woody with some raspberries. Okay.
Sample from the bottle at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, berries, wine berries, some tartness and sourness. Pretty good.

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Nice slightly fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sour-ish fruity, raspberry syrup, mild vinegar, sour raspberries, sorrel, oak, minerals, dark malts, berry skin. Taste is sour-ish dry, vinegar, sorrel, sour raspberries, oak, raw rhubarb, berry skin, red berries. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Nice.

Tap @ CBC -16. dark brownish color with a small tan film. acidic aroma with some balsamic vinegar and burnt caramel. tart flavor in the direction of an oud bruin. some vinegar,apple cider and red berries. medium body and avg to soft co2.

Tap at CBC. Pours hazy orange without head. Sour berry, lemon, rhubarb, light funky aroma. Very tart.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is wineous, fruity. Toasted malty. Dry, citric, sourish. Crisp. Lingering fruity. Dry and smooth sourish finish.

750ml bottle. Near black colour. Finger of head. Raspberry comes through well in the aroma. Taste is quite juicy, quite fruity, quite malty. Low on acidity and quite balanced and drinkable, but without a real spark.

Bottle from the reclaimed barnwood furniture thing in the corner of my dining room. The top of it has surly anniversary beers and darkness vintages but inside the bottom is large format bottles that dont fit in my beer fridge. I opened the bottle using my dogfish head bottle opener from the Rehoboth Beach locations. Its black. I poured it into my "I like beer from here" inside the outline of the state of Minnesota. The beer pours a hazy reddish brown with filmy white head, a nice ring lasting as I sip through it. The aroma is pungent raspberry, woody oak. Tart berries, sweet and delicious. Mouth puckering sour upon first taste. As it settles into my mouth I get the berries. Those sweet fucking berries. Taste is outstanding, dry and jam like. Would put this on my toast if I could. Still sour but deliciously so. Would drink this regularly if I could. Im really enjoying it. Somewhat disappointed I split it with my fiancé. She loves it also. Need morem

Bottle thanks to PaulUnwin for the share. Cheers, Paul! Pours a red-brown with a small off-tan head. Nose is some caramel, some berries, funk, sour fruit, raspberry jam, oak, and vinegar. Flavor is similar with some berries, jam, sour notes, brett, oak, and vinegar. Wow. That is complex and relaxed. Light to medium in body and very nice overall.

750ml bottle acquired via trade on BA. Thanks, bro. Pours a deeper murky hazed brownish ruby hue, darker colors and middle show a touch of ruby glow on the edges. Sizable offwhite head atop is frothy, a nice full filmy layer with a thick ringer that sticks around nicely. Aromas are tart and punchy, sour raspberry immediately inflames the senses with potent lactic twang, oak and cobwebs. Mellow toasty and carmelized malts with fall beind as big seedy raspberry, subtle red wine and earthy elements meet a metallic and yogurty twang. Raspberries dominate the nose, potent and lush, seedy and fleshy with a tannic appeal that melds with the barrel, mellow funk and a malt body that doesnt offer too much behind. Initial is lots of raspberry, nice tartness and seedy appeal meet subtle toast and biscuit, yogurt and vanilla. Sour raspberries, macerated and dried out. Just enough sweetness to remind as that punchy sour lactic appeal, lingering tannic skin and oak work in some gentle cocoa, toast and biscuity appeal behind. Mellow funk, pleasant and driving raspberry elements sustain. This one is sour but even keeled, the raspberries do the work largely but have a synergy here. Never acidic or harsh, this one gives some nice fluffs of biscuit and toast, mellow oak and lots of seedy raspberry tart and dry skin appeal. Pleasant stuff. Not the prettiest pour but a really on point nose, good flavors and flow, nothing overwhelming and a good gentle touch from the darker malt base. Tasty, punchy, righteous stuff.
Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Dark brown body with a small offwhite head. Tart raspberries, sweet raspberries, oak, light vinegar. Delicous.

Bottle at The Bullerup Pubben reopening/Solar Eclipse pt. 2 tasting. It pours dark ruby brown with a creamy off white head. The aroma is loads of oak and raspberries. Some cherry notes and almond. Sweet berries, loads of oak and wood with great raspberry notes. Awesome!

Blend 005. Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Pours dark amber with a creamy thin white head. Aroma is intense and complex wood, caramel, dark fruit and juicy raspberries. Vinous fruity and dry flavor. Absolutely stunning! Thanks to Hallinghansen and Plovmand for convincing me trading this.

great stuff here, thanks scott .. . deep raspberry, dark fruit, sour fruit, bats, and tart red leather .. mouth is full and bad like rodney .. very rich and tasty, a sipper .. really good beer . . . . Where ever jazz is, I is. Bebops my home.

750mL bottle, pours a deep dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma brings out juicy raspberries, a touch of oak and funk. Flavour is about the same, with loads of juicy raspberries, light funk and a touch of oak. Really well-balanced and forthcoming on the raspberries. Excellent.

Sampled at esbls. Dark red brown. Funky looking. A lot of fruitiness going on in the aroma. Some funk. Earth and plenty of funk. First sip is exactly like that. A lot of sweetness. Berries are nice. Subtle. Good stuff and one I would love to spend some time with.

22 oz. bottle shared by jckp64- thanks again, John! This is my first foray into The Rare Barrels offerings, and damn, they did not disappoint. This one pours a clear browned amber with a beige ring for a head. Loads of raspberries throughout, sour and sweet, with tannins, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, oak, vanilla, and bretty funk. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet and sour mouthfeel thats in absolutely perfect balance. This is really impressive and its drinking excellent right now.

Bottle @ BVerys. Hazy light brown pour with a small head. Sort of turbid, cloudy. Nose has strong oak character. Muscular woodiness. Tart cherry skin. Some acid. Fruit leather. Flavors buggy and sharp. Sweet/tart. Wood and cherry. Light yogurt. Fruit skin. Medium body, active carbonation. Solid American sour brown.

Sampled at GABF 2015 with Andrew, Mel and Frank. Pours a deep murky brown body with light off white lacing. Nose is sour raspberries, strawberry jam, wood and sour fruit. Mouthfeel is bright and acidic with notes of sour oak, lemon, raspberries, balsamic vinegar and earthy wood.
Chriss bottle. Raspberry oak and sour blend together. Small head. Full mouthfeel. Masterful.

Bottle via trade with Pedro, thanks man. Poured an ugly muddy brown body under a smaller fizzy beige head. Aroma is loads of raspberry, lemon sourness, fruit skins, wet wood. Flavor is the same but super sour, like a raspberry Sour Patch Kid, wood notes on the end. The body is harshly acidic with lots of lingering burning sour heat and average carbonation. Really good.
Sampled at Great American Beer Festival 9/24/15. Cloudy brown appearance. Aroma of sour notes, raspberries, light wood and a little funk. A nice, puckering, fruity, sour flavor. Very good overall.

Shared by Jeff. Muddy brown color. Very good berry flavors with dry oak, wood, and red wine. Moderately sour, some balsamic. A little sweet. Lots of complexity. Thanks for sharing this, great beer. Low carbonation, which is fine.
Bottle shared by Jeff - thanks! Murky brown pour with a carbonated head. Oak really jumps out. Raspberry. Lively palate. This is killer!
Bottle shared at tasting. Pours cloudy brown. Not much on the aroma but the great sour raspberry in the taste. Some oak barrel as well. Really interesting and good.

Small brownish head, fast gone over deep redbrown to mahogany beer. Raspberry, vanilla, fresh oak, lactic acid, pralines with raspberry ganache. Raspberry, incense, vinous, serious lactic acid, lemon. Puckeringly acid, acidburn, overattenuated. Superb, outstanding beer!
650ml bottle. It is a nice sour beer, raspberries, tart, funk, some vinousness and oak. Good.

750, corked and foiled (I think). Thanks, J! Damn, what a delightful surprise. Pours an opaque dark brown with no head or lacing at all. Big bright sharp nose thats definitely a unified, balanced element, rather than an impressionist painting with its disparate colors--showing clear fresh raspberries but layered back through oak and a bit of balsamic-y tang. Absolutely coherent and nuanced. Creamy medium body with minimal carb. Mild sharpness on the attach from the acid content, hard to tell if its more fruit or more funk in nature. Oak is there, funk is there, fruit is there, its all so, so, so good. These guys are just killin it to death every time they slap a name on a bottle.
Bottle - Pours amber tan head. Nose/taste of raspberry with pit, funk, chocolate, oak, sour fruit - medium body.
Bottle. Ruby brown pour with white head. Raspberry, tart, spice, and yeast aromas. Sweet and tart raspberries, funk and sour flavors.

750ml bottle pours dark walnut brown with light red edges, medium head. Nose is sweet funky raspberry, cola, leather, some wet oak, hint of vinegar. Taste is similar with some nice funky old wood, dark berry and raspberry skin, cola, touch of roast. Finishes with a bit of sweetness, nice acidity, lacto funk, meidum tartness, old wood, earthy berry. Pretty good.
750ml bottle. Red waxed. Poured a reddish tinted brown color with a smaller sized head. Raspberries/berries, woody, vanilla, dark fruits, funky, and some vinegar.

Bottle shared by Kyle. Pours a hazy deep amber brown with a the near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of sour red fruits with a decent amount acid a bit of dark grains for the backbone. Flavor is similar with sour red fruits and dark grains as well as touch of acid.

The beer is a deep magenta with some brown to it. Small, fizzy-ish head, beige. Looks rather cloudy. The aroma is satisfyingly jammy and definitely beats the taste for me. Lots of raspberries with a good mix of sour and sweet, so mostly sour. Light funk and moderate oak. Taste is nice but the fruit gets a bit muddled and doesnt quite have the bright jammy flavor of the aroma. Tart berries with underripe apricots. Some sour grape-iness. Light oak. Fairly dry. Medium body, thins out some in the finish. Good sour, up near the top for what Ive had from TRB.
Pouring at EBF 2015. Pours a hazed ruby brown with a thin tan head. Soft berries, funk, wood on the nose. Big acetic notes, chewy fruit and long acid on the finish.

Aroma: Raspberry Jam, Cranberry

Appearance: Reddish/Brownish Hue, Passes Little Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Raspberry Jammmmmmm, Cranberries, Mild Red Plum

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mildly Bitter

Tap at Apex in Portland. Pours dark hazy brown with minimal tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, raspberries, sour yeast, berry. Taste is light to Ned bodied, med carbonation, med sour, great fruit flavored, very balanced with fruitiness to sour. Overall, delicious.

EBF. Pours a medium red with a small ofwhite rim on top that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of raspberry syrup and fresh raspberries. Taste is of raspberries and raspberry jam but with a tart edge. Body is medium, carbonation too and the acidity is never too much and just refreshing. Overall a good one, not their best but still a really solid option!

sample @ EBF 2015. murky light brown-orange with a small light beige head, some retention and lacing. fragrant and fresh vibrant raspberries, spicy and woody - some tannins, light acidity - medium complexity as of flora - some tart citric peaks; sweetish red maltiness - some toasts, pepper. light carbonation, light body; lightly sweet, tart and herbal-spicy finish. slightly unbalanced and low-fi flora with bright raspberry fruits.

EBF.
Pours brown with low beige head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of fruits. Taste is of sourness, fruits. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft carbonation. Overall: A tad too sour. Nice berries. Good but a tad overdone.

Sample @ EBF.

Appearance: Hazy brown with a small bubbly off-white head and not much lacing. 

Aroma: Raspberries (jammy) up front along earthy notes and a bit of caramel. Light roasted presence. Not much complexity here. 

Taste: It get much better here. Moderate sour and bit acetic but not overpowering. Its also raspberries (jam) forward but theres much more after with chocolate-y notes, roasted, oak, vanilla, delicate brettanomyces presence and earthy notes.

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Lingering raspberries presence. A bit too acidic for my liking.

Overall: Decent sour. The "dark" components doesnt takes much place, which is good for me. Not super complex and the balance is average.
(Échantillonné au Bagby Fest): Des framboises dans un lit de terre humide chargées dune ronde acidité. Simple, efficace et trop délicat pour ne boire quun échantillon.
Really nice raspberry oud bruin. Aroma is jammy raspberry vanilla funk light balsamic and toast. Taste is tart and jammy fruit. So tasty and complex.

Rare Barrel tasting @ Malt Attacks, Brussels, thanks Pierre for sharing the bottles.
75cl, sur un acajou profond, voire brun foncé, col léger blanc-cassé.
Arôme offre un somptueux caractère de framboise avec ce bouquet aigrelet-fruité très terreux et accompagné dun léger malté.
Palais est fruité avec un profil framboise qui est vraiment bien placé et ajoute caractère et raffinement à la bière. Pour une fois, le côté brett reste en retrait. Fin malté et caramel avec une petite pointe de grillé le tout assemblant très bien les framboises.

loved this one, huge thanks Dak! The berries blend together the different flavors, somewhere between a sour stout and an oud bruin. No roast at all however, very tasty, something about sour raspberry jam. yum yum.
Brown pour, beige head. Loads of raspberries, balsamic, roast, good sourness, oak, dark fruits.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Pours clear and dark copper with a small, creamy, off-white head. The aroma is infused with tons of raspberries and, after it warms, a hint of acetone as well. Full-bodied with tingly carbonation. The flavor is sour and fruity - as with the nose, loads of raspberries here too. Tart, fruity, finish. Not roasty in any way. That component is long gone. World-class brew courtesy of 50belair!
Bottle. Clear dark Amber pour with an off white head. Sour raspberry aromas. Tart raspberries and nothing much else. No depth, no complexity here. Below average body and mouthfeel.
Bottle - pours murky brown. Oak, sour, and slight raspberry in the nose. The taste is straight up vinegar with a hint of raspberry. Its not too harsh but it dies off in the end.

750 mL bottle shared by OldSock at the DC Summer Saison & Sour Tasting, 7/12/14. Pours a hazy copper color with a thin head. Fair head retention. Aroma of tart sour berries, peppery funk, jammy fruits. The taste is tart jammy fruits, mild vegetal notes. Medium bodied.
Bottle courtesy of Mad Mike, thank you! Cloudy brown color. Aroma of dark fruit, roast. Taste is softly sour winter fruit.

Bottle thanks to Mike. Pours a cloudy brown ruby with small frothy off white head. The aroma is strong oak, cherry skin, and tannic. Medium mouthfeeel with strong vinious and oak flavors, tart raspberry, and lingering dryness. Very good.

Lots of raspberry here with a little cherry. Finishes sour and very tart, with a good dose of underlying bretta. Pours reddish brown with ok head and lacing. Thanks to Oldsock for sharing this bottle.

Bottle shared by oldsock. Pours clear brown with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is toast and cookie malt, dates and figs with earthy hops and bitterness. Flavor is acetic cherries, vinous notes, light hops and bitterness, supporting malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Sample at Culmination Fest: Poured a reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma is sour fruit. Taste was tart with raspberry, woodsy, and sour finish.

On tap at WTF poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of raspberry, toffee and light roastiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of roastiness, raspberry and toffee with a crisp dry tart lingering roasty raspberry finish.

Crimson red head. Small light head. Nose of cherries, yeasty and raspberry. Tiny bit of duct tape. Hmm. Not as sharp and acidic as the nose suggested. Tons of tart and sweet raspberry. Tough of balsamic vinegar. Very raw and fruit salad with melon, cherry and grapes. Very akin to kombucha in the mouthfeel.

Tap at the brewery..Pour is very dark red with no head but some bubbles..Nose is nice raspberries, cherries, wet oak, berries, some mustyness and yogurt...Taste is nice fruited raspberries, bugs, barrel, faint dark malts with some nice funky tartness..Very solid carb and balance.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a deep ruby black with a coarse tan froth. Fresh clean raspberry aroma, like a nice sorbet. Flavor is pleasant as well: juicy dark ripe raspberries are really captured in this beer. It also has less acetic influence than many of their other beers. Nice yogurt/sorbet throughout and lingering with the tartness. Their best offering so far.

Full pour at the brewery. Aroma is sour forward with seeded fruit notes: black cherry, raspberry, some leather and faint funk. Not super jammy like Atrial or Upland, but a nice mix. Not much malt presence and perhaps a touch of oak. Pours surprisingly dark with thin white head that hugs the sides of the glass. Taste follows aroma closely with tart raspberry, cherry pits, some red wine vinegar and lemon. The body is light with nice bubbly carbonation. Definitely fruit forward on the finish and a little dry. I think a beer this fruit forward can benefit from a little more malt. There isnt very much brett character, with the sour and oak work well with the fruit.

Pours a hazy red/amber with small, quickly dissipating head. Aroma of raspberries, leather, sour, and citrus. Taste of raspberries upfront with sour tartness. It finishes again with subtle raspberries and very mild barnyard funkiness. Very nice. Overall, one of my favorite Rare Barrel sours, and thats saying a lot.

Some rich malt, fresh raspberry that lingers and sour oakiness make for a mighty fine brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ The Rare Barrel. Dark mahogany pour with a khaki head. Raspberry and blackberry on the nose. Vinegar, caramel, and some oak. Flavor is quite sour with a fair amount of balsamic vinegar. Sweet caramel, raspberry, and blackberry. A bit of chocolate. A fair amount of oak and a hint of vanilla.

Dark clear black in color... Aroma of oak, tart berries... Flavor is intensely tart up front, gives way to notes of raspberries, blackberries, oak... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Rare Barrel tasting room. Pours a dark purple. Aroma has notes of plum and chocolate. Heavy vinegar notes, slight tootsie roll sweetness, and plum. Very acetic, which is a theme with this brewery.

On tap at Bottles in El Sobrante. It pours a very dark red, almost black color with an off white head. The aroma is mouthwatering with cherries, raspberries and good funk. Not much malt character to speak of. The flavor is tart black cherries, hard candy with hints of dark malt and red wine vinegar. A little spice near the finish. It has a pretty light body which in this kind of beer leaves it a bit lifeless, but other than that it has great flavor and a nice level of puckering sourness without being harsh. Well done.
Off tap at Provisions. Pours a dark amber with an thick tan head. Aromas of dark fruit, oak, brett. Tastes of dark raspberries and oak. Very Good!

Tasting at BeerCraft. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Moderately acidic, oak, cherries, raspberries. Dry finish. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at City Beer. Pours dark brown with a rich tan head and a slightly sour chocolate aroma. There is a subtle fruity sourness to the dark malt flavor. The raspberries are a nice addition to the barrel, resulting in a wider palate.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Tap @ City Beer. Pours deep brown to black with a small tan head and decent lacing. Aroma is cherries, oak, tart lemons. Flavor is the same, light sweet, light tart with a dry finish. Picked up something that I thought was a bit odd but couldnt place - now I realize it was raspberry after reading the description. Medium body, oaky, fruity and nice. Re review on tap at trb. Amazing raspberry jam.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Tap at city beer in SF. Rich brown, no head. Tart cherry, raspberry aroma, very faint note of funk. Body is dry. Flavor is also tart cherry and some lactic notes. Cherry flavor lingers long on the palate. Excellent beer. If the rest of their beer turns out this good, expect Rare Barrel to be in high demand.
